text: Gah! I'm so sorry I missed this somehow, <@U7SL518D6>! Can you explain a little more? Are you talking about the dom of the actual rendered page or the sidebar?

hey no problem, I’m referring to the DOM of the sidebar. Specifically the `<li>` elements within the flex columns. And if you guys have a better name for the data attribute that’d be fine. I just want to be able to grab that data, then I can add a button through the extension to open that module in the design manager.

*For anyone who had the extension installed and found that the dark theme activated automatically on them. To deactivate it right click the extension icon choose options, then uncheck the checkbox and hit save.*

I’ve released a patch to the extension that fixes this <http://issue.It|issue.It> could take several hours to take effect, restarting Google Chrome should force the update as well. Sorry about the inconvenience.

Obviously if you would like to use the feature go into options and enable it.

If you would like to help by testing out builds that are being worked on, you can do that see the github for instructions.
<@U7SL518D6> pinned a message to this channel.
*idea*: Add customizable keyboard shortcodes, specially for functions like cache, otherwise for me is almost the same effort click twice on the extension that randomly pressing keys there
Agreed, I like that idea
can certainly say a keyboard shortcut for the cachebuster would be nice. debug as well
<https://github.com/williamspiro/HubSpot-Developer-Extension/issues/37>
there issue added
that was fast :stuck_out_tongue:

say out of curiosity what is the hot-reload.js file for in the extension? looked like you used it to live update the extension stylesheet as you were working on the dark theme - that’s just a guess based on reading through it
<@U7SL518D6> pinned a message to this channel.

yup, exactly.
If you have the extension with the developer/local files, that will auto-reload the extension when a file changes, so its really comfortable to upgrades :slightly_smiling_face:
nice!
Hey <@U22PJPGK0>  welcome!
nice work guys!

Thanks, we’re kinda looking to use the extension to add convenience features to HubSpot for developers(things that us developers wish we had but are likely lower priority for you guys to directly add in). Hopefully we can get some more people interested in helping, but I’m pretty happy with where we’re at with it so far.

Added contextual awareness to the extension popup in a new feature branch. It now knows if you’re in the HS back end, Design Manager 1 or Design Manager 2, as well as if you’re viewing the HS docs.

All I have it doing so far is hiding the irrelevant buttons based on where you are.

For example all of the query param buttons are hidden when in the backend because they’re useless there.
If I have time tonight I will see about moving the Theme toggle to the pop-up menu and it will only display when viewing the design manager.

I think that is really useful to keep the popup clean, but at the same time I am starting to think if that could become a bit dizzy moving options around.
What if we wrap those "popups" as tabs inside the popup and auto focus the tab instead?
That is a good solution.
